1:00 AM PDT We are working to determine root cause of the elevated error rates and latencies for Amazon S3 in the US-STANDARD Region.
1:08 AM PDT We believe we have identified the root cause of the elevated error rates and latencies for requests to the US-STANDARD Region and are working to resolve the issue.
1:52 AM PDT We are actively working on the recovery process, focusing on multiple steps in parallel. While we are in recovery, customers will continue to see elevated error rate and latencies.
2:38 AM PDT We continue to execute on our recovery plan and have taken multiple steps to reduce latencies and error rates for Amazon S3 in US-STANDARD. Customers may continue to experience elevated latencies and error rates as we proceed through our recovery plan.
3:25 AM PDT We are still working through our recovery plan.
3:36 AM PDT We are beginning to see recovery in error rates and latencies for Amazon S3.
3:46 AM PDT Between 12:08 AM and 3:40 AM PDT, Amazon S3 experienced elevated error rates and latencies. We identified the root cause and pursued multiple paths to recovery. The error has been corrected and the service is operating normally.
5:52 AM PDT Between 12:08 AM and 3:40 AM PDT in the Amazon S3 US-STANDARD Region (i.e. US-East), Amazon S3 experienced elevated error rates due to a configuration error in one of the systems that Amazon S3 uses to manage request traffic. We pursued the wrong root cause initially, which prompted us to try restorative actions that didn't solve the issue. Once we understood the real root cause, we resolved the issue relatively quickly and restored normal operations. During the time of the event, the elevated S3 API error rate led to impact on services that depend on Amazon S3 such as EMR which relies on S3 for object storage and EC2 which relies on S3 to store some AMIs.
12:28 PM PDT Between 12:03 PM to 12:19 PM PDT we experienced elevated errors for requests made to Amazon S3 in the US-STANDARD Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:00 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region.

4:41 AM PDT We continue to work towards recovery of the issue causing increased error rates for the DynamoDB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region.
4:52 AM PDT We want to give you more information about what is happening. The root cause began with a portion of our metadata service within DynamoDB. This is an internal sub-service which manages table and partition information. Our recovery efforts are now focused on restoring metadata operations. We will be throttling APIs as we work on recovery.

7:50 AM PDT We continue to see recovery of read and write operations and continue to work on restoring all other operations.
8:16 AM PDT We are seeing significant recovery of read and write operations and continue to work on restoring all other operations.
9:12 AM PDT Between 2:13 AM and 8:15 AM PDT we experienced high error rates for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

Additional details can be found here.

Instance connectivity and EBS volume performance are not affected.
7:43 AM PDT Error rates for impacted APIs are beginning to recover and new instance launches are starting to succeed. We continue to work on restoring full service functionality.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates and Latencies
archive.description:
5:11 AM PDT We are investigating increased API error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region.
6:09 AM PDT We can confirm increased error rates and latencies to Machine Learning APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region and continue to work towards resolution.
6:12 AM PDT We can confirm increased error rates and latencies to Machine Learning APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region and continue to work towards resolution.
9:04 AM PDT Between 2:30 AM and 8:40 AM PDT, Amazon Maching Learning experienced increased error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:31 AM PDT We are currently experiencing elevated error rates affecting customers logging into the Console. Customers who have already logged into the Console are not affected.
7:55 AM PDT We are seeing recovery on the error rates affecting customers logging into the Console. Customers who have already logged into the Console are not affected.
8:14 AM PDT Between 06:01 AM and 07:15 AM PDT, the AWS Management Console experienced elevated error rates affecting customers logging into the Console. The issue has been resolved and the AWS Management Console is now operating normally.

6:44 AM PDT We are investigating increased API error rates in the US-EAST-1 Region.
8:19 AM PDT Between 6:44 AM PDT and 7:45 AM PDT we experienced increased API error rates for AppStream in the US-EAST-1 Region.The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:06 AM PDT We are experiencing login issues and elevated error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-1 region. We are working toward resolution.
8:06 AM PDT We are beginning to see recovery for login, error rates, and latencies. We are continuing to work on fully restoring the service
8:32 AM PDT Between 2:16 AM PDT and 7:41 AM PDT, we experienced elevated login issues, error rates, and latencies in the US-EAST-1 region. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:29 AM PDT Between 2:40 AM and 7:45 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. CloudSearch resolved API issues, however, creating new domains and indexing operations functionality are still unavailable in US-EAST-1. Existing search domains continue to serve search queries. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:25 PM PDT We've heard from a small number of customers that they're still experiencing heightened error rates on DynamoDB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Weâ€™ve investigated this and seen that one of the metadata partitions is not taking as much traffic as expected and, for a small subset of those customers with keys that reside on this partition, their error rates are higher than normal. Weâ€™re working on resolving this as soon as possible.
5:03 PM PDT Weâ€™re continuing to work on restoring full traffic to the affected partition to resolve the increased DynamoDB API error rates some customers have seen in the US-EAST-1 Region. Weâ€™re doing this carefully to make sure the fix behaves as expected.
7:23 PM PDT We have updated the metadata service with a fix to restore full traffic to the affected partition. We are seeing significant reduction in error rates some customers experienced earlier in the US-EAST-1 Region.
8:48 PM PDT We are continuing to work towards resolving the small number of remaining customer tables that are facing elevated error rates.
11:25 PM PDT The fix we deployed several hours ago to the metadata service worked as expected, and the partition that was previously not taking full traffic is now doing so. The service is now operating normally.

6:33 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region.
7:25 AM PDT We continue to investigate the increased latency and errors for the DynamoDB metadata service. The team is rolling out the remaining mitigations that have been developed to mitigate the errors we encountered earlier this week.
9:26 AM PDT We continue to actively work on deploying mitigations to address the increased latencies and error rates for API requests. We have seen improvements in both request latencies and error rates.
11:13 AM PDT Between 5:12 AM and 9:21 AM PDT, we experienced periods of increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. API request errors and latencies have recovered but we will keep this event open while we continue to monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations that have been developed to mitigate the errors we encountered earlier this week. We may see further periods of low error rates as we continue to deploy these mitigations and will continue to provide updates.
12:04 PM PDT One of our mitigations has increased error rates and latencies for some tables. We are actively working to resolve these.
2:30 PM PDT Between 10:31 AM and 1:30 PM we experienced periods of increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. API request errors and latencies have recovered and we continue to keep this event open as we monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations.
5:13 PM PDT We can confirm that the elevated error rates and latencies for the DynamoDB APIs have recovered in the US-EAST-1 Region. The mitigations deployed up to this point have stabilized the service and we will continue to rollout additional mitigations as described in the summary of events from earlier in the week: https://aws.amazon.com/message/5467D2 . The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:33 AM PDT We are currently experiencing elevated error rates for the Auto Scaling Service in the US-EAST-1 Region. Currently running instances in the Auto Scaling groups are not impacted.
7:35 AM PDT The API error rates for Auto Scaling are recovering in the US-EAST-1 Region due to mitigations being deployed by the DynamoDB team. Existing instances were unaffected, and scaling activities are succeeding.
8:28 AM PDT We continue to see periods of increased API error rates for Auto Scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are working closely with the DynamoDB team as mitigations are deployed. Existing instances were unaffected by the errors, and scaling activities are succeeding.
9:21 AM PDT We continue to see periods of increased API error rates and scaling activity delays for Auto Scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to work with the DynamoDB team as mitigations are deployed. Existing instances remain unaffected by the errors.
9:54 AM PDT We are seeing improvements in the API error rates for Auto Scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region due to mitigations being deployed by the DynamoDB team. Existing instances were unaffected by the errors, and scaling activities are succeeding.
12:41 PM PDT We continue to see periods of increased API error rates and scaling activity delays for Auto Scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to work with the DynamoDB team as mitigations are deployed. Existing instances were unaffected by the errors.
2:37 PM PDT Between 11:23 AM and 1:30 PM PDT we experienced periods of increased API error rates and delayed scaling activities in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were unaffected by the errors. The service is now operating normally, and we continue to keep this event open as we monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations.
3:58 PM PDT We can confirm that the elevated API error rates and scaling activity delays have been resolved. Existing instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:01 AM PDT We are currently experiencing increased EBS API error rates, and increased errors for new instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region.
8:38 AM PDT We are currently experiencing increased EBS API error rates, and increased errors for new instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances and volumes are not impacted.
10:45 AM PDT We have seen improvements in EBS API error rates. API errors may have resulted in delays terminating some instances. EBS volume performance was not impacted.
12:44 PM PDT We continue to experience elevated API error rates for the EBS APIs and the RunInstances API in the US-EAST-1 Region. Running instances and EBS volume performance are not impacted.
2:48 PM PDT Between 11:14 AM and 2:04 PM PDT we experienced elevated error rates for the EBS APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. While EBS API error rates have recovered, we continue to see a low level of errors for the RunInstances API. Running instances and EBS volume performance remain unaffected.
3:04 PM PDT All API error rates have recovered in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to keep this event open as we monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations.
4:01 PM PDT We can confirm that the elevated error rates for the EBS and RunInstances APIs have recovered. Running instances and EBS volume performance were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased API error rates and provisioning latencies
archive.description:
8:35 AM PDT We can confirm increased API error rates as well as provisioning and scaling latencies for some environments in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:15 AM PDT Between 6:05 AM and 9:16 AM PDT, customers experienced elevated API error rates and delays in environment creation and deployment operations in the US-EAST-1 Region. The service is operating normally.
12:57 PM PDT We can confirm increased API latencies and delays in provisioning, scaling and deployment operations in the US-EAST-1 Region.
2:42 PM PDT Between 1:00 PM and 2:10 PM PDT we experienced periods of increased API latencies and delays in provisioning, scaling, and deployment operations in the US-EAST-1 Region. The API latencies and delays have recovered and we continue to keep this event open as we monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations.
3:53 PM PDT We can confirm recovery for increased API error rates and latencies as well as delays in provisioning, scaling and deployment operations. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:43 AM PDT We are investigating increased latencies for processing some alarms in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:16 AM PDT Between 6:05 AM and 9:16 AM PDT, customers may have experienced some delayed alarms in the US-EAST-1 Region. The service is operating normally.

1:06 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latency impacting all Data Pipeline APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Active Pipeline Activities are progressing but are in some cases delayed. Customers can expect intermittent delays view Pipeline status in the Data Pipeline AWS console.
2:45 PM PDT Between 11:10 AM and 1:30 PM PDT we experienced periods of increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. API request errors and latencies have recovered and we continue to keep this event open as we monitor.
3:56 PM PDT We can confirm that latencies and error rates have recovered on all Data Pipeline APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. As a result of the previous errors, running Pipeline Activities may have been delayed or timed out. If timed out Activities exceeded their 'maximumRetries' users may see a status of failed. In such cases, please review the output of those Activities to confirm their status. You can â€œRerunâ€ failed Activities in the Execution Details of your Console. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:21 PM PDT We are investigating increased API error rates and event processing latency in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are working closely with the DynamoDB team as mitigations are deployed.
2:34 PM PDT We are seeing improvements in both error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region due to mitigations deployed by the DynamoDB team.
3:20 PM PDT Between 1:04 PM and 1:39 PM PDT we experienced periods of increased API error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region. During this time, new Lambda functions experienced increased provisioning latencies, resulting in invocation errors. Recently executed functions were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased error rates and instance launch latency
archive.description: 2:57 PM PDT Between 2:03 PM and 2:33 PM PDT, Auto Scaling experienced elevated API error rates and instance launch times in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were not affected. The service is now operating normally.

5:14 AM PDT We are investigating a period of elevated error rates for the EC2 APIs and new instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. During this period some instances experienced impaired connectivity and some EBS volumes experienced degraded IO performance in a single Availability Zone.
6:05 AM PDT Between 4:34 AM and 4:52 AM PDT we experienced elevated error rates for the EC2 APIs and new instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. During this period some instances experienced impaired connectivity and some EBS volumes experienced degraded IO performance in a single Availability Zone. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

The majority of these recovered when the networking connectivity issue was resolved and we continue towards full recovery for the remaining Single-AZ database instances.
7:14 AM PDT We can confirm that all database instances have fully recovered. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

Health checks to back-end instances in the affected Availability Zone also saw impact. Request traffic was shifted away from the affected Availability Zone during this time. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:41 AM PDT We are investigating a period of connectivity issues affecting some nodes in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The problem has been resolved and recovery is proceeding.
7:31 AM PDT Between 4:34 AM and 7:15 AM PDT we experienced connectivity issues affecting some nodes in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The majority of these recovered when the networking issue was resolved at 4:52 AM PDT and we can confirm that all nodes have now fully recovered. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated API faults and latencies in US-WEST-2
archive.description:
6:14 PM PDT We can confirm elevated CloudWatch API faults and delayed metrics in US-WEST-2 Region. Customers querying data for the time range up to 5:35 PM PDT are experiencing elevated fault rates when calling the GetMetricStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region. These metrics are delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on the delayed metrics may have transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. The service is processing all new metrics normally. We are working to recover the delayed metric data.
7:05 PM PDT We are continuing to work to recover the affected metric data prior to 5:35 PM PDT. The service is processing all new metrics normally and alarms are unaffected.
8:04 PM PDT Between 4:54 PM PDT and 7:41 PM PDT, customers experienced an elevated fault rate when calling the GetMetricStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region. Some metrics were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on delayed metrics transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The service is operating normally.

current.description: 11:20 AM PDT Between 10:20 and 10:40 AM PDT customers experienced elevated error rates when accessing the CloudFront API and CloudFront Management Console. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally. End-user requests for content from our edge locations were not affected by this issue.
